benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to account

covered: Valid Request: Numerous scenarios validate successful PUT updates (204) for various account states and payloads.
Authorization: Tests cover missing and valid authentication headers (TC12) and success cases.
Non-Existing Resource: Test for non-existent accountId (TC07).
Edge Cases: Tests for empty array (TC15), maximum field lengths (TC16), extra properties (TC17), partial input mix (TC18), timeout (TC19).
Large Payloads: Tests with 100 CustomField objects (TC04) and near-limit payload (TC26).
Validation & Security: Tests cover malformed JSON (TC10), missing required headers (TC08), invalid CustomField schema (TC11), invalid input (TC20/TC21).
Server/Dependency Resilience: Scenarios for server downtime (TC13), dependency failure (TC14), transient network recovery (TC22).
Integration & Backward Compatibility: Audit log integration (TC27), external reporting (TC28), backward compatibility with previous API clients (TC24).
Performance & Concurrency: Concurrent requests (TC25) and payload-size performance (TC26).
Regression: Duplicate field names (TC23), backward compatibility (TC24).
gaps: Partial Update Semantics: No explicit tests ensuring partial updates are rejected or allowed (PUT).
Concurrency on a single resource: No test simulates race conditions on the same account update.
Rate Limiting: No tests for throttling or rate limiting.
Caching Behavior: No tests for caching headers or ETag related to PUT responses or updated resources.
Internal Server Error (500): No explicit 500 error scenario (database failure).
Pagination: PUT typically does not paginate; no pagination tests are applicable.
404 Not Found: No explicit 404 test for non-existent resource; current test TC07 uses 400; consider adding 404 test for REST semantics.
recommendations: Add a test to validate concurrency on a single resource to detect race conditions (two simultaneous updates to the same account).
Add 500 Internal Server Error scenario (e.g., database failure) to ensure proper handling and logging.
Add rate limiting tests to verify throttling and correct handling under load.
Add caching tests (ETag/Cache-Control) to cover caching semantics for updated resources or responses, if applicable.
Introduce a 404 Not Found test for non-existent account to align with REST conventions, in addition to the current 400 test.
Clarify partial update semantics and add tests accordingly (e.g., attempt to update only a subset of fields and verify allowed/disallowed).
